content: I'm trying to familiarize myself with benchmarking in rust and am confused about the expectations of #[bench]. Are targets annotated with bench considered test targets? Is either criterion or libtest (for benchmakring) considered a test framework? What does it mean for a benchmark to "fail"?
You should prefer criterion over #[bench]. Criterion has much better statistic analysis and is stable unlike #[bench].
Sure, but are benchmarks considered tests? If I use criterion, would a benchmark be able to "fail"?
or is it more akin to rustdoc in that it generates something (in this case the benchmarking results)
